clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of Effect of Sanyinjiao (SP6) Acupressure on Early Diabetic Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: For diabetic patient with persisted albuminuria under the intensive control on blood pressure and blood glucose, the non-invasive method of acupressure at Sanyinjiao (SP6) is easy to use and significantly effect on albuminuria reduction in patients of diabetic nephropathy.

primary_outcome.measure: urinary spot albumin creatine excretion ratio (UACR) change

arm_group.description: In addition to maintain current treatment included oral anti-hyperglycemia agent and ACEI(angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor ) or ARB, subjects should wear ankle band at Sanyinjiao point ( calf , ankle on the foot tip 3 inch ), with the thumb pressing daily five minutes later and carry more than four hours for 8 weeks

In the control group, ankle band was place as same as the those for the SA(Sanyinjiao acupressor) group, but was wearing at the acupoint of Sanyinjiao with anti- surface without pressure. It was applied four hours per day for 8 weeks
